briefdescription.para: Initializes the XENSIV™ PAS CO2 sensor and configures it to use the specified I2C peripheral.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the pressure sensor object. The caller must allocate the memory for this object but the init function will initialize its contents
Pointer to an initialized I2C object

simplesect.para: CY_RSLT_SUCCESS if properly initialized[, an error indicating what went wrong otherwise

briefdescription.para: Initializes the XENSIV™ PAS CO2 sensor, and configures it to use the specified UART peripheral.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the pressure sensor object. The caller must allocate the memory for this object but the init function will initialize its contents
Pointer to an initialized UART object

simplesect.para: CY_RSLT_SUCCESS if the initialization was successful; an error indicating what went wrong otherwise

memberdef.argsstring: (const xensiv_pasco2_t *dev, const xensiv_pasco2_interrupt_config_t int_config, uint16_t alarm_threshold, cyhal_gpio_t pin, uint8_t intr_priority, cyhal_gpio_event_callback_t callback, void *callback_arg)
memberdef.name: xensiv_pasco2_mtb_interrupt_init

briefdescription.para: Configures a GPIO pin as an interrupt for the PAS CO2 sensor.

detaileddescription.para:
This initializes and configures the pin as an interrupt, and calls the PAS CO2 interrupt configuration API with the application-supplied settings structure
Should be called only after xensiv_pasco2_mtb_init_i2c or xensiv_pasco2_mtb_init_uart.
dev
Pointer to the PAS CO2 sensor device
int_config
New sensor device interrupt configuration to apply
alarm_threshold
New alarm threshold value to apply
pin
Pin connected to the INT pin of the sensor
intr_priority
Priority for NVIC interrupt events
callback
Function to call when the specified event happens. Pass NULL to unregister the handler
callback_arg
Generic argument that will be provided to the callback when called; can be NULL
CY_RSLT_SUCCESS if interrupt was successfully enabled; an error occurred while initializing the pin otherwise

briefdescription.para: Reads the CO2 value value if available.

detaileddescription.para:
This checks whether a new CO2 value is available, in which case it returns it and sets the new pressure reference value for the next measurement
dev
Pointer to the PAS CO2 device
press_ref
New pressure reference value to apply
co2_ppm_val
Pointer to populate with the CO2 ppm value
CY_RSLT_SUCCESS if PPM value was successfully read. XENSIV_PASCO2_RSLT_READ_NRDY if the measurement value is not ready yet; an error indicating what went wrong otherwise

memberdef.argsstring: (void *ctx, uint16_t dev_addr, const uint8_t *tx_buffer, size_t tx_len, uint8_t *rx_buffer, size_t rx_len)
memberdef.name: xensiv_pasco2_plat_i2c_transfer

briefdescription.para: Target platform-specific function to perform I2C write/read transfer.

detaileddescription.para:
Synchronously writes a block of data and optionally receive a block of data.
ctx
Target platform object
dev_addr
device address (7-bit)
tx_buffer
I2C send data
tx_len
I2C send data size
rx_buffer
I2C receive data
Can be NULL to indicate no read access.
rx_len
I2C receive data size
XENSIV_PASCO2_OK if the I2C transfer was successful; an error indicating what went wrong otherwise

briefdescription.para: Target platform-specific function to read over UART.

simplesect.para: XENSIV_PASCO2_OK if the UART read was successful; an error indicating what went wrong otherwise

briefdescription.para: Target platform-specific function to write over UART.

simplesect.para: XENSIV_PASCO2_OK if the UART write was successful; an error indicating what went wrong otherwise

briefdescription.para: Target platform-specific function that waits for a specified time period in milliseconds.

parameterdescription.para: Number of miliseconds to wait for

briefdescription.para: Target platform-specific function to reverse the byte order (16-bit)
Target platform-specific function that implements a runtime assertion; used to verify the assumptions made by the program and take appropiate actions if assumption is false.
Description: This file contains the MTB platform functions implementation for interacting with the XENSIV™ PAS CO2 sensor.
